did.unittitle: The Cuneen Hackett Family Papers

repository.corpname: Marist College Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: The Cunneen-Hackett Papers consists of materials from the estate of Charlotte Cunneen-Hackett. Various belongings including family Bibles, books concerning religious and nature themes, personal journals, diaries and photo albums are included in the collection. There is also another section dedicated to correspondence of New York State Senator Hatfield and information regarding Senate Bills he was influential in forming.
did.physloc: Please contact the Marist College Archives and Special Collections for information regarding use and access of this collection.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Cunneen Hackett Papers consists of family Bibles, religious, nature and other misc. books, personal journals, photo albums and artifacts. Senator Hatfield’s correspondence with local citizens and businesses as well as his Senate bills and information concerning the bills is included.

acqinfo.head: Acquisitions Information
acqinfo.p: Former attorney for the Cunneen-Hackett estate John Gartland presented the collection to Marist College.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Cunneen-Hackett’s were an influential family from the Poughkeepsie area that took an active role in local politics and law. John Mulford Hackett, a successful lawyer and assemblyman for Dutchess County, and his wife Charlotte Cunneen, also a lawyer, were married in 1919 and established themselves in the Hudson Valley. Although they never had children, they both became involved in many social and civic activities centering on the education, religion and encouragement of children. After John’s death in 1954, Charlotte continued reaching out to the community and became an important supporter for the local boys and girls scout troops. Charlotte passed away in 1971 but a charitable trust fund left in her will allows her generous memory to live on. Former Trustee John J. Gartland Jr. channeled the income from her fund to various causes in the Hudson Valley, such as the donation of her home to the Boy Scouts, the restoration of the Vassar Home and Institute into the Cunneen-Hackett Cultural Arts Center as well as to projects at Marist College.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions to Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Description of item, date, location of item in order of series, box number, folder number ], in The Cuneen Hackett Family Papers, Archives and Special Collections, James A. Cannavino Library, Marist College.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: These records are organized into three series: 1) Books of the Cunned-Hackett's has six subseries, 2) Senator Hatfield has three subseries, and 3) Artifacts
Series are arranged by subject or chronologically

did.unittitle: 1. Books of the Cunneen-Hackett’s

scopecontent.p: Series contains books from the Cunneen-Hackett Papers which includes 4 Bibles, 20 books concerning religion, nature and other miscellaneous subjects, and 13 personal journals and photograph albums.

arrangement.p: Books in Subject order and MLA format. Personal journals and albums are chronological.

did.unittitle: Subseries 1.1: Bibles
The Holy Bible (1850)
Holy Bible (1858)
The Holy Bible (1863)
The Holy Bible (undated)
Subseries 1.2: Religious Books
Common Prayer and the Hymnal. NY: Oxford University Press, 1898. (Paperback)
Dawson, Coningsby. The Seventh Christmas. NY: Henry Holt and Company, 1917. (Hardcover)
Good News for Modern Man, the New Testament in Today’s English. NY: American Bible Society 1966 (paperback)
Hall, Bennie Caroline. Spiritual Diary. NY: Jordan House, 1940, (Hardcover)
New Testament and Psalms. NY: American Bible Society: 1848. (Hardcover)
Rice, Helen Steiner. “Just for You” a Special Collection of
Rodriguez, H. Manuel. Cancionero Juvenil (Religious music). Madrid, 1947. (Hardcover)
The Book of Common Prayer. NY: Oxford University Press, 1935. (Hardcover)
Subseries 1.3: Nature Books
Chapman Frank M., What Bird is That? NY: D. Appleton and Company, 1920. (Hardcover)
Mathews, Schuyler F. Field Book of Wild Birds and Their Music. NY: Knickerbocker Press, 1904. (Hardcover)
Poucher, J. Wilson. Stories of the Wild Flowers. NY: 1931. (Hardcover)
Reed, Chester A. Bird Guide. NY: Doubleday, Page & Co., 1920. (Hardcover)
Reed, Chester A. Flower Guide. NY: Doubleday, Page & Co., 1917. (Hardcover)
Rogers, Julia Ellen. Tree Guide. NY: Doubleday, Page & Co., 1922. (Hardcover)
Subseries 1.4: Misc. Books
Bennett, C.E. Advance and Retreat to Saratoga in the American Revolution. NY: Robson, Adee, Schenectady, 1927. (Paperback)
In Washington. Daughters of the American Revolution Washington DC: 1965. (Paperback)
Ruckeyser, Muriel. The Colors of the Day a Celebration of the Vassar Centennial. NY: May 10, 1961. (Paperback)
Seward’s, W.H. Travels Around the World. NY: D. Appleton and Company, 1873. (Hardcover)
The Giwell Book. Boy Scouts Association. London: C.J. Cousland & Sons Ltd., 1965. (Hardcover)
Van Dyke, Henry. The Story of the Other Wise Man and the Mansion. NY: Harper & Brothers, 1920. (Hardcover)
Subseries 1.5: Personal Journals and Diaries
Law diary of an apprentice lawyer “interning” at a law office 1836
Family records of births and marriages 1846
Private diary of Charlotte Cunneen, November12, 1907
Marriage diary of John Mulford Hackett and Charlotte -Elizabeth Cunneen. Includes marriage certificate and John Hackett Sr.’s citizenship Papers February 12, 1957
Travel Journal of Mrs. John Mulford Hackett May 10, 1961
Personal prayer book
Subseries 1.6: Photography and albums
Photo album of Hudson Valley and friends/family September, 1903
Photo album, 1900’s-10.
John Hackett’s photo album from 1912
Photo album of family and Hudson 1950’s-60’s
Photo album of home and family/friends 1950’s-60’s
Travel Journal of Mrs. John Mulford Hackett May 10, 1961
Report of Charlotte Cunneen Hackett Charitable Trust for the Years 1972-79
Picture of John Hackett’s Home (presently Boy Scout -Headquarters)
2. Senator Hatfield

scopecontent.p: Series contains personal letters of the senator to various citizens and businesses concerning the passage of 12 bills and misc. correspondence. Other Information, research and reports about the bills are also included.

3. Artifacts

scopecontent.p: Series contains a hand weight from the late nineteenth century and a notary press from the Hackett-Williams law firm also from the late nineteenth century is included.

did.unittitle: Hand Weight
Notary Press Used in Original Law Offices of Hackett and Williams (Late 1800’s)
